title: Alta Alella 2017 Parvus Chardonnay (Alella)
description: Punchy aromas of citrus and tropical fruits are loaded with sweaty-smelling pyrazines. A pulling, lean palate has the texture of grape skins. Salty orange and pineapple flavors move fast and finish briny and tart.

title: Mancan NV Rosé (California)
description: This wine is light coral in color, has modest apple and melon aromas and a soft texture that carries mild canteloupe flavors. It is low in acidity and may have a touch of sugar to soften the finish.

title: Nacido del Quórum 2015 NDQ 3 Mesas en Barrica Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: This patchy Monastrell deals grassy aromas mixed with vinegar and wild-berry notes. The palate, much like the nose, is jumpy and hard to get into. Savory plum flavors are green and raw, while this is untamed on a finish with heat.

title: Matchbook 2017 Tinto Rey Estate Bottled Rosé (Dunnigan Hills)
description: This medium-bodied wine is low on fruitiness and soft in terms of mouthfeel. It has mild melon flavors and little noticeable acidity.

title: SoloContigo 2015 Primera Amanta Malbec (Uco Valley)
description: Jammy raspberry aromas share space on the nose with horse hide and saddle leather scents. A lean juice-like palate carries almost no weight or substance, while this tastes mostly of mint, clove and generic red fruits.

title: Trus 2014 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Prune and raisin aromas and flavors are so dominant that this is exposed as an overripe wine with cooked characteristics. While not awful, there's no balance, acidity or life to this.

title: Viñestral 2015 Tinto Joven  (Rioja)
description: Earthy, underripe berry aromas are raw, stalky and roasted. This feels edgy, not smooth or elegant. Saucy flavors of red plum and currant are lean and snappy on the finish.

title: Bota Box NV RedVolution Red (California)
description: A bit smoky and oaky in aroma, this medium-bodied wine has ripe, lightly sweet and candied-fruit flavors like plums and cherries.

title: Brancott 2017 Flight Song Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Part of a new brigade of lighter calorie wines, this offers pungent aromas of buttered beans, wet grass alongside underripe guava and melons. The palate underwhelms, showing an off-kilter spritz amidst searing acidity.

title: Chakana 2017 Maipe Malbec Rosé (Mendoza)
description: Wayward aromas are earthy and not terribly fresh. This has a dark tint and a clunky mouthfeel. Dry peppery flavors of stale citrus are briny.

title: Fulkerson 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)
description: Odd aromas of savory cannellini beans and plastic ride over a mild lemongrass note in this wine. The palate is light in feel and mild in concentration, with a sweet floral note on the close.

title: Fulkerson 2017 Pinot Noir Rosé (Finger Lakes)
description: Creamy strawberry and balsamic make for an odd combination in this wine. It's light in concentration and low on acid, making it feel flat and simple.

title: American House Wine 2016 Rosé of Zinfandel (California)
description: This lightly sweet and light-bodied wine made from Zinfandel grapes has a vivid pink color, muted aromas and candy-like flavors. It's simple and soft in character.

title: Dablon 2016 Pinot Noir Rosé (Lake Michigan Shore)
description: Extremely floral aromas of potpourri are joined by bruised strawberry and overripe raspberry on the nose. The palate offers an underripe strawberry flavors leading into a sour and bruised fruit finish.

title: Dos Familias 2017 Familia Colombi Private Selection Rosé (Mendoza)
description: Chunky, earthy aromas echo the wine's burnished-orange color. This tastes salty and briny, with dry yet sour citrus and leafy notes. Whatever future this has isn't bright.

title: Longevity 2011 Phil-osophy Vintner Select Red (Livermore Valley)
description: This wine has a dusty sunbaked aroma, full body and very mature fruit and spice flavors. Prune, sun-dried tomato and balsamic flavors come through.

title: Torre Castillo 2015 Alegre Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Jumpy aromas suggest wet animal, with milk chocolate in the background. This feels plump but also choppy, rough and grating. Green notes infiltrate jammy berry and milk chocolate flavors, while this is bitter, weedy tasting and disjointed on the finish.

title: Mt. Konocti Winery 2016 Petite Rosé (Lake County)
description: Unusually full bodied for a rosé, this wine feels rather fat and mouth-coating, and has earthy, almost sweet flavors.

title: Château l'Oasis 2017 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This earthy, rustic wine seems to have missed out on the crisp fruit. It does have spice and caramel flavors which could appeal. A hint of acidity comes through at the end.

title: La Chiripada 2013 Artist Series I Cabernet Sauvignon (New Mexico)
description: High-toned black-berry and cherry aromas are sharp against licorice and cedar on the nose. Intense, gravely tannins assault the palate, with subtle flavors of leather, spice and raw wood struggling to make an appearance. The flavors evaporate on the finish, leaving a mouthcoating of chewy tannins.

title: Luigi Bosca 2015 La Linda Private Selection Old Vines Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Underripe fruit aromas are oaky, and that's about all the nose has to offer. In the mouth, this Malbec is hollow yet abrasive. Murky underripe fruit has resulted in a nutty, leafy, gritty flavor profile that carries over to the finish.
designation: La Linda Private Selection Old Vines

title: Cellardoor 2014 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Maine)
description: A vanilla aroma explodes from the glass in this blend of Frontenac Gris and Frontenac Blanc, with additional tones of ripe yellow peach and freshly whipped cream. The palate turns sour with a searing lime note that rides over gummy peach and vanilla flavors. The bubbles are pillowy in feel while the finish brings flavors reminiscent of sour beer and sour lime candy.

title: Cruz Alta 2016 Reserve Bonarda (Mendoza)
description: Funky foxy aromas of wet dog and briary berry fruits lead to a raw sticky palate. Weedy berry flavors come with a smear of oaky clove, while this stays afoul on the finish.

title: Ossian 2016 Quintaluna Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
description: Unclean, fruitless aromas are dirty and gritty. In the mouth, this feels chunky and flat. Oxidized bitter flavors don't amount to much, while this is low on pulse come the finish.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

title: Evaia 2017 Rosé (Rioja)
description: A dull and oxidized nose smells like little more than chewing gum. And that's really about as good as this gets. The rest of the package is stale, oxidized and going nowhere.

title: Essentially Geared NV Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This canned wine has a light touch of carbonation, almost neutral aromas and rustic but drinkable flavors of grapefruit and herbs.

title: Aridus 2015 Limited Production Malbec (Arizona)
description: Muted aromas of cherry NyQuil and hard candies are tempered by whispers of sweet baking spice on the nose. Thick and flat, with papery tannins, the palate shows overripe strawberry and cherry dragged down by a bitter medicinal undercurrent. The finish is clipped, with a final swipe of cough syrup.

title: Layer Cake 2015 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Minty currant aromas are green at the core, with a note of bath soap. A candied palate lacks structure and is flimsy. Weedy berry and clove flavors end flat and sweet, with an excess of residual sugar.

title: Patricia Green Cellars 2016 Estate Vineyard Bonshaw Block Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)
description: This 100% Pommard clone wine from a 1990 planting is immensely deep, dark and textural, with complex aromas that instantly draw one in. Its compact berry, plum jam and baking spice scents come with underlying mineral and earth notes. It hits the palate with a powerfully woven matrix of lush flavors: blueberry, plum, cherry, chocolate, butterscotch and toasted coconut. It's thick, supple and lingering—an ethereal and extraordinary wine.

title: Anderson Conn Valley 2015 Aurum Red (Napa Valley)
description: Aurum, Latin for gold, is the first release of this high-level, small-production wine—a blend of 83% Cabernet Sauvignon, 9% Petit Verdot, 7% Cabernet Franc and 1% Merlot. Spicy clove, black pepper and cigar box highlight a grippy, structured and expansive palate of blackberry and cherry. It's eager for more time in the cellar; enjoy 2025–2035.
